title: TransXChange
text:
TransXChange is a UK national XML based data standard for the interchange of bus route and timetable information between bus operators, the <a href="Vehicle%20and%20Operator%20Services%20Agency">Vehicle and Operator Services Agency</a>, <a href="local%20authorities">local authorities</a> and <a href="passenger%20transport%20executive">passenger transport executive</a>s, and others involved in the provision of passenger information.
The format is a <a href="UK">UK</a> national de facto standard sponsored by the UK <a href="Department%20of%20Transport">Department of Transport</a>. The standard is part of a family of coherent transport related <a href="XML">XML</a> standards that follow UK <a href="GovTalk">GovTalk</a> guidelines and are based on the <a href="European%20Committee%20for%20Standardization">CEN</a> <a href="Transmodel">Transmodel</a> conceptual model.
Although TransXChange is currently used mainly to exchange bus timetables, it may also be used for schedules for rail and other modes.
History.
TransXChange is intended as a successor to the widely used <a href="ATCO-CIF">ATCO-CIF</a> format for bus timetables and was developed as a modernised representation of ATCO-CIF content, using an XML representation based on the <a href="Transmodel">Transmodel</a> Reference model for Public Transport.
TransXChange is supported by all main UK suppliers of bus timetable systems and has also been used to exchange data for metro and other modes.

TransXChange Publisher.
TransXChange is accompanied by a free tool, the TransXChange Publisher, which renders a TransXChange document into a human readable format, matrix and route map. PDF and html formats are supported.
Future development.
Addition modules are envisaged to cover ticketing and fares through the proposed <a href="FareXChange">FareXChange</a> standard. TransXChange can also be used for other <a href="Mode%20of%20transport">modes of transport</a> - it is already used for metro and tram systems, route and timetable data.
